title: Casual Friday
description: Michael returns to Dunder Mifflin and brings Ryan and Pam in as salespeople, but the existing salespeople demand that Michael return the clients they stole back to them. Meanwhile, some employees take the idea of Casual Friday too far.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: At least once a year, I like to bring in some of my Kevin's Famous Chili.  The trick is to undercook the onions.  Everybody is going to get to know each other in the pot.  I'm serious about this stuff.  I'm up the night before pressing garlic and dicing whole tomatoes.  I toast my own Ancho chilies.  It's a recipe passed down from Malone's for generations.  It's probably the thing I do best.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Someone is returning!  He started his own company, and now he's back.  Who could it be? I'll give you a hint.  He is a man.  A man you have missed with all your heart.  A man who has ruined all other men for you.  Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [whispering] Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispering] Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whispering] It's Michael Scott.  [applause; Michael jumps through sign] Hold it up.  Conference room, five minutes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I guess the first order of business is to welcome back me, and Pam and Ryan.  [scattered applause] And how about casual Friday again, huh?  Reinstituting casual Friday?  You all look great.  What I want to do right now is try something a little different.  I'm going to throw it out there, starting with this meeting.  I want you guys to run it.  I want you to say whatever you want,  take it away.  Your meeting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [after a few moments of silence]  Wh-what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If there is something that you would like to say as a group, then by all means, you may say it to me right now.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: People are dressed inappropriately.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Take it up with Toby.  What I want you to do, is I want you to look inward.  And I want you to reflect.  And I want you to say something different.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can you give us a hint?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I needed salespeople for my new paper company,  everyone here turned their back on me.  Am I going to ask them to beg for forgiveness?  No. Am I going to ask for big, crying apology? No.  Am I going to ask them to slit their wrists for me? No.  I just want a tiny, microscopic version of that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar, what were you going to say?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Nothing.  I didn't say anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Do I still have a job here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not important. [everyone mutters] Okay, alright.  Yes. Yes, you have a job.  Frankly, you have a job because Ryan and Pam are starting with us as salesmen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, what?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How is that going to work?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's going to work very smoothly, because Pam and Ryan are bringing over a ton of clients from Michael Scott Paper Company and-

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You mean the clients you stole from us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah , aren't we getting those clients back?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you lost those clients.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I call foul, sir.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You were bought out.  So the company then bought out all of the stolen clients.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Dwight.  Let me explain something to you.  I set the rules and you follow them.  Blindly. Okay?   And if you have a problem with that then you can talk to our complaint department.  It's a trash can.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [to Ryan] Don't fall in love with me, kid.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs]  Boscov's at the Steamtown Mall?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It sure looked good on the mannequin.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, you have good taste.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, thanks.  I sure wish I had more time to talk to my clients, though.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Isn't that what you said to a bunch of my clients when you were stealing them?  That I didn't have enough time for them?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I, um...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Close your mouth, sweetie.  You look like a trout.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The man is wearing sandals.  I don't need to see Oscar's toes at work.  Gross!  I mean he looks like he just got off the boat.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Can't you just not look at his feet?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Excuse me? Oh. You're so educated, aren't you Toby?  So trained to deal with a hysterical woman.  I don't want to look at his feet.  [storms off] Do your job!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, I was in the Seminary for a year and dropped out 'cause I wanted to have sex with this girl, Cathy.  Followed her to Scranton.  Took the first job I could find in H.R.  Later she divorced me.  So no, I wouldn't say I have a passion for H.R.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [hands Ryan a soda] There you are, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, thanks, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pamela.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fresh hot ink.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: "New File System".

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Trust me, Stanley,  you're going to want to read this memo very carefully.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I am not changing the way I do my files.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no.  This goes for all of you.  Believe me, you are going to want to heat my words.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When held over heat the invisible ink will reveal that everyone should meet at the warehouse immediately.  Do not ask me where I got the invisible ink.  Urine.  It was urine.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm sorry you're offended by my shoes, but I am not going to drive home to change.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I could loan you a pair of socks.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, they're clean.  I was going to wear them to volleyball practice later.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Andrew Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, what are you still doing at your desk?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What are you still doing not at your desk?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you even read the memo?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All my files are now in reverse alphabetical order-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you idiot.  There is a code embedded in the memo.  Listen, you need to round up all the salesmen, except for Ryan and Pam, and get them down to the warehouse pronto.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, it is on like a prawn who yawns at dawn.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stop doing rhyming poetry.  Just tell them, please.  God, the simplest thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We're in crisis mode here, do you understand?  The two unqualified so-called salespeople are being favored because they all failed together.  And frankly, I'm not convinced that Michael and Pam didn't have a thing going while they were gone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I address that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you're too close.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stanley, how do you feel about those two taking your clients?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It's not right.  I don't like it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He doesn't like it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You don't take my clients away and give them to a secretary.  [sighs] No offense, Jim.  I think she's very pretty.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Her face is okay, but- Jesus!  What -what are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I don't know.  I saw a crowd.  I thought there might be a dogfight or something-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get out!  We need to do something.  I'm thinking maybe a coup or we take Ryan hostage.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Those sound too harsh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I'm not saying we do those things.  I'm saying something like those things.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Of course.  What is like a hostage?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excellent question.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We could write a strong-worded letter.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Words will never be enough.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Strongly-painted picture.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, pictures are too interpretive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I just say something?  I know that tempers are high, but I think the best way to handle this might be to just talk to Michael directly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.  Well, that-that's a great idea, Jim.  Oh, I totally see your point.  Okay, we'll talk to Michael directly.  So uh,  meeting is over, I guess.  I'll see everyone upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great.  See you upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: C'mon. [whispers]  Guys. Psst, listen.  Now is the time for action.  I'm talking action-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That one's great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You look so classy in that picture.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do?  Well-Where is that bowl?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, you have a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Michael Scott Paper Company only.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I think you're going to want to cool it with that 'cause it's starting to upset the other salesmen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well--

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Tough.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will-no, no.  I'll talk to them when they all get back from the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is awkward to talk about, but there may or may not be-but definitely is-a mutiny  forming in the warehouse right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Against who?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You.  Us.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's gotta be because they all want their clients.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The old Michael Scott might have taken this, but not the new Michael Scott.  They are in for a bitter surprise.  I am not to be truffled with.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Six weeks ago, none of these people wanted to come with me.  You two were the only ones with the stones to follow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was  us, right there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We were something else.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What you gotta do is you gotta go down to that warehouse and you gotta crack some skulls.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Chiklis style.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, the Commish.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes, but Chiklis Shield style.  Not Commish style.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah. The Shield.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: It's crazy what's going on out there today, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know.  Yeah, it's...kinda-

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Sometimes it's best just to say out of it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's true.  That's right.  Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Want to play a game?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey gang. Where you been?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Lunch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where'd you eat?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: A restaurant.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What'd you have, Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I had a salmon salad.  With water, no ice.  I was going to get a soda, but the waiter talked me out of it.  Her name was Flo, she had black hair.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I had Mexican food.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So since you guys already ate, you won't be eating the stuff you brought with you for lunch, will you?  [walks into kitchen] Oh, wow, Stanley.  Is that egg salad?  Andy brought some salmon.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That looks great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, is that a meat sandwich?  You guys hungry?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I can eat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm going to o have some of this meat sandwich.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's pony.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mom. What kind of sauce is on your salmon?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dijonnaise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm.  Thanks for going out, guys.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, Meredith.  Can I talk to you privately for a second?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: About what?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Your outfit.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What? What's wrong with my outfit?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You-you might consider pulling it down a touch.  It's ri-it's riding up a little high.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: A bunch of prudes.  You know, Oscar's allowed to wear sandals,  but I'm not allowed to wear open-toed shoes?  [pulls down dress, office gasps]  Is that how it goes?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Meredith, your boob is out.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Fine.  [pulls dress up, everyone gasps again]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Meredith, too far!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Dammit, Meredith, where are your panties?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: It's casual day.  Happy?  [bends over to get a file, exposing herself to the office]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [playing chess with Jim]  No. IF you do that, I'm gonna do that.  IF you do that, I'm gonna do that.  IF you do this, I'm gonna do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, what if I just do this?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You don't want to do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm just hiding out until all this stuff blows over.  With Creed. Playing chess. At work.  He's winning.  I feel like I'm describing a dream I had.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm sorry you feel that way, Mr. Bart.  Is there anything I can do to make things better?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa.  Give me the phone.  Give me the phone.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's my client.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Exactly.  This is your first complaint in ten years.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Give me the phone.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Things have been generally good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Give me the phone.  Tell him Dwight Schrute wants to talk to him.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Look, uh, Mr. Bart...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hi, Mr. Bart.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: At these prices with this service...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, it's Dwight here.  Give me the phone.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You're not gonna find this anywhere else.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute here.  Hey, don't hang up.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, no, no.  Sir, don't listen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know times are tough right now,  and I laud your thriftiness. [tries to pull phone out of Ryan's hand] Ryan!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ryan, hand the phone over.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Stop flustering me, everybody!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Who let this boy on the phone?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah! Mr. Bart!  Ugh! [slams phone down[ I cannot believe you lost that account.  He was my client for ten years!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You made him lose the account by screaming at him the entire time.  It's okay, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're a secretary! What do you know?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And you're a temp and I'm taking your phone.   I'm confiscating this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey guys.  You know what I want you to do?  Shake hands, get over it.  That was not a shake, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We want our clients back or we quit, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who quits?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Me.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: And me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Me too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You guys gotta be kidding.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, we gotta be deadly serious.  We'll start our own paper company.  The Schrute-Bernard-Lapin-Vance...Stanley Paper Company.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I love it.  I love this idea, and I fully support you.  As a matter of fact, I'm going to give you some seed money.  [throws money at Phyllis] There you go.  There's some seed money for you.  And you can take it, no hard feelings.  But if you stay, I want an apology,  and I want a big one.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You want us to apologize to you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes I do.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's completely backwards.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's frontward's.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, you thought you were attacking corporate, but we were the ones who got hurt.  You should be apologizing to us.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: That's right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, you always said we were a family.  Then you went after us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No matter how I look at this, I am in the wrong.  And I have looked at this thing, like a hundred different ways.  From my point of view, from their point of view...98 others.  And the bottom line, I am in the wrong.  I'm the bad guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need you to arrange a meeting between me and the sales staff without Ryan and Pam knowing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gasp.  Are you talking about a secret meeting?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whatever you guys did earlier.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't know that first things about secret meetings.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just do it, okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll do-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get 'em there.  Get 'em there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll do the best I can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Deceit does not come easy to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay, okay.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I really love your outfit.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Thank you so much for saying that.  I can't believe that Toby thinks this is inappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You look like J-Lo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So from the bottom of my heart to the top of my heart, I am sorry.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Are you giving us our clients back?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If we could just focus and go down the line, and everyone would say,  "apology accepted", I think we would all feel better.  And then we can break out  my gift to you-complimentary white chocolate bark.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Nobody likes that stuff except for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They wouldn't make it unless people liked it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, just give us our clients back.  That's all we care about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  If I give you your clients back there won't be enough clients for Ryan and Pam, and I promised both of them they were gonna be salespeople.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: So?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fine, have your clients.  I can see that's what you wanted all along.  [everyone mutters "okay"] However, I rescind my apology.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's fair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are not reacting at all as I had hoped.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What'd I tell you about building forts in my warehouse?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael gave all of our clients back to their old salespeople, so now there's not enough for both me and Pam to stay on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He can only keep one of us as a salesperson now.  He'll make his decision by the end of the day.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I think you should get it.  You really grew into it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.  I think you should get it.  You've changed a lot and you'd be good at it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: If you really think that, will you tell that to Michael?  That would go a long way coming from you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: So hey, I'm want to set you up with my daughter.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I'm engaged to Pam.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I thought you were gay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Then why would you want to set me up with your daughter?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim. Can I talk to you for a minute?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure.  Let me just finish this turn.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [puts Scrabble pieces on board] And Bingo was his name.  Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Challenge.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need your help.  This whole Pam/Ryan debate is screwing with my head.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't want to be biased, but I am very close to Ryan.  You know that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're close with Pam too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Eh, she's nice, I guess.  You know what?  Best thing to do, Pros and Cons list.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pro for Ryan, he went to business school, he's my number one choice.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, that's-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I like his hair.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Cons, Ryan.  He defrauded the company.  He has never made a sale.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He definitely stole my iPod.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That sounds pretty biased.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You didn't hear my pros.  Environmentally-conscious 'cause his mom drives him to work everyday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Pam, pros.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I like her.  I think that she is a fast learner.  Cons, she doesn't always follow through.  Sh-New York and the whole art school thing.  And Roy.  She has a weird voice.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's not true.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't need to tell you that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think she'd be a really good salesperson.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't think you are being totally impartial though, because you haven't said one bad thing about Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I won't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  So be it, then you've lost credibility.  And I'm going to go with my guy, and that's Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.  You're right, sometimes when she's tired, she can be a little bit shrill.  But that's not a weird voice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, wow!  Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Take it easy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ho-ho, man!  Wow. [in a high-pitched voice] Honey!  I want you to bring the garbage out.  'Cause I'm not going to have sex with you unless you bring out the garba-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have a very difficult decision to make.  It's like last week I was at the video store.  Do I rent Devil Wears Prada again? Or do I finally get around to seeing Sophie's Choice?  It is what you would call a classic difficult decision.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You don't understand clothing, Toby.  You're dressed like this amorphous blob of khaki.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: All right, look, what you gotta understand is that when you come to work, you give up certain rights.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen up, Flenderson.  You're being weak and ineffectual.  I'm cowboying this meeting, okay?  Here are the new rules.  Earth tones only.  Also, women are forbidden to wear pants.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: All right, come.  Sit down, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'm running this meeting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's debatable.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's not.  It's not.  Sit down or I am writing you up.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Ooh, where has this guy been?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Casual Fridays are cancelled.  [everyone protests]  Let's just not do it anymore.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're running from the problem.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: There's not a single appropriate outfit in this whole-except mine, quite honestly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, can you come in here, please?  Have a seat.  [clears throat] Well, there's no easy way of saying this.  So I think I will just...drag it out.  Since the dawn of time there has been-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just tell me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I gave Ryan the sales job.  There just weren't enough clients for the two of you.  So I had to-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm sorry, sorry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, I get it. [Michael laughs] Why are you giggling?  Is this a joke?  [Michael continues to laugh] Michael, is this- did I get the job?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] Yes, you did.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I did?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: For real, you're not kidding?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you-no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I did?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you're the best person for the job.  You're going to be great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, Michael, thank you.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] Oh, oh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.  You will not be sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You should have seen your face.  Oh man! Oh, that was classic.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. [laughing] I really thought I didn't get it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.  'Cause you said I didn't

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, man.  That was really good.  That was really good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What about Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know, I offered him his temp job back.  We'll see.  He was not happy at all when I offered him this job and then I told him he didn't get the job, so-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.  Maybe you shouldn't fake fire people anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't appreciate you telling me what to do.  So clean out your desk, you are through here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! What's our receptionists name?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Erin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Could you send her in?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [opens door] Erin.  Michael wants to see you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is very difficult to say, but no one here like you in the office and we are going to have to let you go.  [pick up phone] Hank, could you come up here please?  Hank is our security guard-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, I can go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He will be ushering you out.  [starts laughing]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, your face!  Oh!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Is-do the people-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I'm kidding.  No, you're not-you're not fired.  Yet.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Do they not like me, though?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know, actually.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay.
